revised_title: Molecular Mechanisms of Cell Locomotion and Interactions
tldr: The authors propose a general approach to analyze the motile behavior of cells, focusing on pairs of cells in collision. They use acceleration as a measure of change in motion and demonstrate its advantages over conventional measures like speed and direction. The method is applied to a case study of collisions between normal and malignant cells, providing insights into contact inhibition of locomotion and its failure during malignant invasion.
